intro: Psychotria leptothyrsa var. yapensis, commonly known as the Yap psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, particularly the island of Yap. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. The species is noted for its ornamental value and has been studied for its potential pharmacological properties.
